value.title: Facial recognition company fined by ICO following data breach
value.excerpt: The Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO) is to impose a potential fine of just over £17 million on Clearview AI, a company that describes itself as the “world’s largest facial network”.

value.title: Clearview AI, a facial recognition company, is fined for breach of Britain’s privacy laws.
value.excerpt: The Information Commissioner’s Office said it fined Clearview AI for failing to inform British residents that it was collecting billions of photos from sites including Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn to build its facial recognition software.

value.title: Robot company offers $200K for your face
value.excerpt: A robot manufacturing company is looking for a human face to put on its newest product. Promobot, a European company, said in a press release that it is willing to pay $200,000 to someone for the rights to use their face forever.

value.title: Clearview AI Is Facing A $23 Million Fine Over Facial Recognition In The UK
value.excerpt: The provisional decision comes after a series of BuzzFeed News investigations revealing widespread and sometimes unsanctioned use of the company’s facial recognition software around the world.
